0.title: Amber admits to hitting Depp in recording of their fight, says 'You're a baby, grow up'
0.article_body: Amber Heard could be heard admitting to hitting Johnny Depp in a recording played in court. "I didn't punch you. I'm sorry I didn't hit you across the face in a proper slap, but I was hitting you, it was not punching you," she could be heard saying. "You are such a baby, grow the f**k up, Johnny," she said.

1.title: Death penalty of man who raped, killed 4-yr-old in MP commuted
1.article_body: The Supreme Court has commuted the death sentence of a man, who had raped and murdered a four-year-old girl in Madhya Pradesh in 2013, to 20-year imprisonment. The bench refused to sentence convict Mohd Firoz to imprisonment for the rest of his life, saying, "Every saint has a past and every sinner has a future."

2.title: Arjun undergoes pyshical transformation for 'Made in Heaven 2'; shares post
2.article_body: Actor Arjun Mathur underwent a physical transformation for his upcoming show 'Made in Heaven' season 2. When asked about it, he said, "I had a transformative experience while turning into Karan Mehra under the expert guidance of Samir Jaura." "He knows just how hard he needs to push for you to achieve a goal," he added.

3.title: Prashant Kishor wants to join the party without any preconditions: Cong Gen Secy
3.article_body: Congress General Secretary Tariq Anwar said that Prashant Kishor is willing to join the party without any preconditions and his induction would certainly help the party. He further said that Sonia Gandhi wants to take senior leaders into confidence and seek their opinion on Kishor's entry into the party. "Kishor is a brand and he has proven that," Anwar added.

4.title: Manchester United appoint Erik ten Hag as manager on 3-year deal
4.article_body: Manchester United on Thursday confirmed the appointment of Erik ten Hag as the club's new manager. The 52-year-old's tenure will begin from the end of the current season and go on till June 2025, the club announced. Erik ten Hag is currently the head coach Dutch club Ajax. He won Dutch Eredivisie with the club in 2018-19 and 2020-21.

5.title: Viral pic shows Class 10 students drinking beer in school hostel in Telangana
5.article_body: A picture showing Class 10 students of a government-run school in Telangana's Mancherial drinking beer in their hostel has gone viral on social media. Preliminary investigation by school authorities revealed that the students were celebrating a farewell party on the night of April 17. While an enquiry has been ordered, an officer said the hostel warden failed in his duties.

6.title: Tesla reports $3.32 bn profit in Q1, 658% rise year-on-year
6.article_body: Tesla has reported a $3.32 billion profit in the first quarter of 2022, a 658% increase from the $438 million reported in the same period last year. Its revenue for the quarter stood at  $18.76 billion, beating estimates of $17.85 billion. Tesla's revenue saw an 81% increase year-over-year, compared to $10.4 billion in revenue in Q1 2021.

7.title: Overwhelmed and grateful: Sanjay on fans cheering for him in cricket stadium
7.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt took to Instagram to share a video of his fans cheering for him when he visited a cricket stadium to support the IPL team Royal Challengers Bangalore. Dutt also posted a picture with actress Raveena Tandon from the stadium. He was seen sporting a T-shirt with name Adheera, which is his character's name in 'KGF: Chapter 2'.

8.title: 4 ivory artefacts seized by wildlife bureau in West Bengal, 1 held
8.article_body: Four ivory artefacts were seized at Kharsarai in West Bengal’s Hooghly on Wednesday. The seizure was made during a joint raid by officers of the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB) of the Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the state forest department, officials said. “One person was arrested...The suspect wanted to sell the statues,” an official said.

9.title: Chinese national gets 20 yrs in jail in Rwanda for beating local man
9.article_body: A Chinese national has been sentenced to 20 years in prison by a Rwandan court for beating up a local man there last year. The accused, Sun Shujun, operated a mine in Rutsiro district and was purportedly filmed beating a man who was tied to a pole. A Rwandan man was also handed prison term for alleged role in crime.

10.title: I think he has much more to give to WI: Narine on Pollard's retirement
10.article_body: Reacting to WI limited-overs captain Kieron Pollard announcing his retirement from international cricket, WI spinner Sunil Narine said, "It's sad, I think he has much more to give to WI." Narine added, "They love to see him play in WI, but he knows best. I think he is going to focus more on T20 cricket around the world."

11.title: Punjab Army man cheated of ₹10 lakh on pretext of sending kin to Canada
11.article_body: A subedar with the Indian Army was allegedly cheated of ₹10 lakh by an ex-serviceman in Punjab on the pretext of sending his wife and son to Canada for jobs. The victim, a resident of Punjab’s Hoshiarpur, is posted in Bikaner, Rajasthan. The victim has posted videos on social media urging the Punjab CM and other ministers to take action.

12.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in B'luru; MDMA crystals worth ₹70 lakh seized
12.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have arrested a Nigerian drug peddler, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said in a tweet on Thursday. Police have also recovered 800 grams of MDMA crystals, estimated to be worth around ₹70 lakh, from his possession. Further, a mobile phone and electronic weighing machine have also been recovered.

13.title: A$AP Rocky released from jail after posting ₹4.2 cr bail bond: Report
13.article_body: Rapper A$AP Rocky who was recently arrested at the Los Angeles International Airport in connection with November 2021 shooting has reportedly been released after paying a bail amount of $550,000 (₹4.19 crore). According to the police, Rocky is accused of firing a handgun at a person on November 6, 2021, following an argument. The victim had suffered a minor injury.

14.title: I was pumped to try it: Ayushmann on portraying an undercover cop in Anek
14.article_body: Speaking about his character in his upcoming film 'Anek', Ayushmann Khurrana said, "[It's] the first time...audience will see me in this avatar. I've played a cop before but this is the first time they'll see me going undercover." "I was...pumped to try my hands at portraying 'Joshua' as it gave me...opportunity to explore something I hadn't done before," he added.

15.title: 3 kids accused of rape & theft flee protection home in Muzaffarnagar
15.article_body: Three children escaped from a government protection home in the Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh, police said on Thursday. Two among them have been involved in a theft case, while the third kid was booked for rape. The assistant superintendent of the protection home along with three guards have also been booked in connection with the case.

16.title: Minorities commission to submit report on Jahangirpuri violence
16.article_body: National Commission for Minorities member Syed Shahezadi said the panel will submit a report to the Centre on communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. "If there's anything which warrants action, then we will surely recommend action," Shahezadi said. Referring to US-based Genocide Watch's report claiming "genocide" of Muslims could take place in India, she said, "Foreigners are totally wrong."

17.title: Man held with ₹30 lakh gold hidden under wig at Delhi airport, video surfaces
17.article_body: A man has been arrested at the Delhi airport for allegedly smuggling 686 grams of gold worth around ₹30 lakh by concealing it inside a wig and in rectum. A video shows customs officials at the airport removing his wig. The passenger arrived at the Delhi airport from Abu Dhabi on Monday, official said.

18.title: SUV driver allegedly runs over stray dog in Bengaluru; booked
18.article_body: Police have booked an SUV driver for allegedly running over and killing a stray dog in Bengaluru's Nagadevanahalli area. The incident reportedly took place when the dog was crossing a road in the city. A Bengaluru-based software engineer and activist, Ramachandra Bhat, registered a case over the incident, following which police booked the driver and launched a hunt for him.

19.title: Roadside bomb blast in Kabul injures 2 children
19.article_body: A roadside bomb blast in Afghanistan's capital Kabul has wounded at least two children on Thursday, a police official said. No group has claimed responsibility for the explosion so far. This comes two days after multiple explosions targeting educational institutions in Kabul killed at least six people, mostly children, and injured 17 others.

20.title: 4 lakh students shifted from private to govt schools in Delhi this year: Kejriwal
20.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during his Karnataka visit said that government schools in the national capital are better than private schools and four lakh students shifted from private to government schools in Delhi this year. Praising the work done by his government, Kejriwal said, "Delhi government has been successful in providing best medical treatment to two crore people for free."

21.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA vacates Champawat seat for CM Dhami
21.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Gahtori, who won the election from the Champawat Assembly seat, resigned as MLA to make way for CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. "The resignation of MLA Kailash Gahtori has been accepted. The Chief Minister will now contest from this seat," said BJP state chief Madan Kaushik. Notably, Dhami had lost election from Khatima to Congress' Bhuwan Chandra Kapri.

22.title: PM Modi lauds entrepreneurs, says India saw 14 unicorns in Q1 2022
22.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said India saw 14 unicorn startups in the first quarter of 2022. He praised the efforts of young entrepreneurs while adding that during the last eight years, many big changes have been implemented in the country which have "behavioural change" at their core. He made the comments while addressing bureaucrats on 15th Civil Services Day.

23.title: Don't be a pawn: Taiwan to Solomon Islands on China security pact
23.article_body: Taiwan on Wednesday warned Solomon Islands against being used as a 'pawn' after latter signed a security pact with China earlier this week. "[The]...deal...could destabilise regional peace and security," Taiwanese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Joanne Ou said. Her remarks come amid concerns by US, Australia and New Zealand that the deal could lead to Chinese military expansionism in Pacific region.

24.title: Haha okey bhai: Kuldeep Yadav to troll asking him to focus on cricket
24.article_body: A troll asked DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav to focus on cricket after he posted a tweet on Premier League club Manchester United amid their match against Liverpool. Responding to the troll, Kuldeep wrote, "Haha okey bhai." Kuldeep is currently the second highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 13 scalps.

25.title: Players lie down on ground as bee attack halts training session, MI share video
25.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) have shared a video showing a bee attack halting their training session. In the video, players can be seen lying down on the ground to protect themselves. "To bee or not to bee in training was a question yesterday!" MI wrote alongside the video. MI are scheduled to face CSK in IPL 2022 tonight.

26.title: Musk confirms Tesla is working on robotaxi with no steering wheel or pedals
26.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while presenting the company's Q1 2022 financial results, confirmed that Tesla is working on a robotaxi. "We're working on a new vehicle...which is a dedicated robotaxi that's highly optimised for autonomy, meaning it would not have [a] steering wheel or pedals," said Musk. "We aspire to reach volume production of that in 2024," added Musk.

27.title: Inshallah got shelved because of Salman & Bhansali's creative differences: Producer
27.article_body: Film producer Jayantilal Gada spoke about Sanjay Leela Bhansali's film 'Inshallah', which was supposed to star actors Salman Khan and Alia Bhatt. Jayantilal said, "We had started work on that film. However...Bhansali and Salman...had some creative differences. I don't know exactly as we don't get into such matters." "So, [Inshallah] got shelved and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' went on floors," he added.

28.title: Omicron can increase risk of respiratory disorder in children: Study
28.article_body: According to study, the Omicron variant of the coronavirus can increase the risk of upper airway infection (UAI) among children. This puts them at higher risk of heart attack and other severe complications. Researchers analysed that amid the Omicron surge, cases of UAI increased. As young children have small and relatively collapsible airways, they are vulnerable to UAI, they added.

29.title: I was doing elaichi: Ajay Devgn after being criticised for ad
29.article_body: Ajay Devgn was asked about actors facing criticism for the products they choose to endorse. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be...I'd say it without naming it because I don't want to promote it; I was doing elaichi," he stated. Ajay had appeared in a pan masala brand's commercial.

30.title: PM Modi can't imprison truth, MLA Mevani's arrest undemocratic: Rahul
30.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that the arrest of MLA Jignesh Mevani was "undemocratic" and "unconstitutional", adding that PM Narendra Modi can't imprison truth. "Modi ji, you can try to crush dissent by abusing the state machinery," he said. Congress leader KC Venugopal also termed Mevani's arrest as unconstitutional and alleged authoritarianism by the BJP.

31.title: Russian warship actually went & f***ed itself: Ukraine as Russia's top warship destroyed
31.article_body: Days after Russian warship 'Moskva' was destroyed after being hit by a Ukrainian Neptune anti-ship cruise missile, Ukraine said, "Russian warship actually went and f***ed itself as recommended." Ukrainian soldiers had told Moskva to "Go f**k yourself" in February. Ukraine also released pictures of postal stamps with the phrase on it that are up for auction.

32.title: If I were at MI, I would've given more overs to Tilak Varma: Harbhajan
32.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said MI haven't utilised Tilak Varma properly with the ball in the ongoing IPL season. "If I were there, I would've certainly bowled him more. He has good action for an off-spinner...he can bowl [during] middle overs," he added. Tilak, who has scored 183 runs in six games, has bowled only two overs so far.

33.title: Underground metro rail from Pune's Swargate to Katraj approved
33.article_body: The Maharashtra government has given permission for the implementation of the underground metro rail from Pune's Swargate to Katraj at an estimated cost of ₹3,668 crore. A final decision was awaited on whether to develop the route underground or elevated. The route will have three stations and the work will be completed by 2027.

34.title: Pic of UK Queen taken when she was aged 2 released on her 96th birthday
34.article_body: The UK Royal Family has shared a photo of Queen Elizabeth II as a toddler to mark her 96th birthday. The photo posted on Royal Family's Twitter handle shows a young Princess Elizabeth in 1928 - when she was two years old. "Then, in 1928, it was never expected she would be Queen," the post read.

35.title: 60-ft kachcha road collapses near mining lease area in J'khand, no one injured
35.article_body: A 60-feet 'kachcha' road collapsed near the temporarily closed mining lease area of Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) in Dhanbad district of Jharkhand on Thursday, the Deputy Commissioner said. No trapping or any death or injury has been reported till now or appears likely, he added. The officer further said that the incident took place at around 8:30 am.

36.title: People will go to watch a play but not films: Plabita Borthakur
36.article_body: Discussing the impact of OTT, actress Plabita Borthakur said, "People will go to watch a play but not films because they know that they will come on OTT soon." "[Due to]...COVID-19, everything has indeed moved to OTT and so have the stars," added Plabita. "Great stars might just surprise us with their acting on OTT," stated Plabita.

37.title: Mumbai Police helps 3-yr-old boy reunite with his family
37.article_body: A three-year-old boy, who was found near Phoenix Mall at VB Nagar, was reunited with his parents with the help of Mumbai Police. Tweeting the photo of their reunion, Mumbai Police wrote, "During interrogation, it was learnt that child resides in Sanjay Nagar Police Chowki jurisdiction." "His parents were traced by Ghatkopar Nirbhaya and reunited safely with them," they added.

38.title: Ponting said 'Either think we aren't prepared or show commitment': Axar
38.article_body: DC all-rounder Axar Patel said their head coach Ricky Ponting gave them two options after COVID-19 cases were reported from their camp ahead of their game against PBKS. "Ponting told us...'[Either] you can think...preparations aren't done. Or you can think outside things aren't in our hands and...show commitment'," revealed Axar. "We [focused] on our game...that was our mindset," he added.

39.title: Cong leaders visit Jahangirpuri to meet families affected by demolition
39.article_body: A group of Congress leaders visited Delhi's Jahangirpuri to meet the families affected by the demolition drive conducted by the MCD yesterday. The delegation will submit a report of the incident to party chief Sonia Gandhi, said Congress leader Imran Pratapgarhi. Former MLA Hari Shanker Gupta said the group wasn't there to disturb peace but only to meet the families.

40.title: 32 gardens named after civic officials' family members in Pune
40.article_body: At least 32 gardens in Pune have been named after family members and relatives of elected representatives, as per Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). According to a PMC mandate, gardens can only be named after national figures or those working in field of environment. This comes weeks after a BJP corporator renamed a garden in city's Salisbury Park after his father.

41.title: No average actor should work with Randeep Hooda: Shalin Bhanot
41.article_body: Sharing his experience while working with actor Randeep Hooda, actor Shalin Bhanot said, "It's a bad experience as one feels...you know a lot, but when you work with such talent you realise how much they prepare." "I felt [like] such an average actor in front of Randeep," added Shalin. "No average actor should work with Randeep," stated Shalin.

42.title: IIT grads-led B'luru edtech startup Newton School raises ₹190 crore
42.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Newton School has raised over ₹190 crore in a Series B funding round led by Steadview Capital. Existing investors Nexus Venture Partners and RTP Global also participated in the round. Newton School was founded by IIT Roorkee graduates Nishant Chandra and Siddharth Maheshwari. The startup raised over ₹36 crore in February last year.

43.title: Karnataka travellers fined ₹10,000 for travelling to Goa without permit
43.article_body: Tourists from Karnataka who were travelling to Goa without a special permit on the long weekend of Good Friday were fined ₹10,262. Around 40 taxis were stopped on their way to Goa and charged the penalty, as per Hindustan Times report. Drivers were reportedly not able to obtain the special permit as RTO offices were closed on the long weekend.

44.title: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba commander killed in encounter in J&K's Baramulla
44.article_body: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Yousuf Kantroo has been killed in an encounter in J&K's Baramulla district, police said on Thursday. He was involved in several killings of civilians and security personnel, including the recent killing of J&K's SPO and his brother and one soldier and one civilian in Budgam district, police said. Incriminating materials have also been recovered from his possession.

45.title: ED raids Jindal Steel offices in forex violation case: Reports
45.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate is conducting searches at Jindal Steel and Power Limited's (JSPL) offices in Delhi and Gurugram in connection with suspected violation of foreign exchange regulations, Moneycontrol reported citing CNBC TV18. JSPL's shares plunged as much as 6% to a three-week low in their biggest fall since mid-March. JSPL was India's fifth largest crude steel producer in 2021.

46.title: Putin hails 'liberation' of Mariupol as Russia claims control of city
46.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday hailed Russia's "liberation" of Mariupol after Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu told him that Moscow controls the Ukrainian port city apart from the Azovstal steel plant. Putin asked his troops not to storm the plant. Instead, he called for his forces to "block off this industrial area so that not even a fly can escape".

47.title: Actress Monalisa shares note for ailing mother, says 'Maa, you're a fighter'
47.article_body: 'Smart Jodi' contestant Monalisa took to Instagram to post some pictures with her mom and revealed that she had not been keeping well for the past one year. The actress wrote, "Last year had been a...tough year for her. She was doing rounds to the hospital and coming back home...Maa, you're a fighter...You gave us strength...This will also [pass]."

48.title: OTT helps actors who would've never got chances in regular films: Arjun
48.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal said OTT has helped in providing a medium to actors who would have "never" been given a chance to work in theatrical films. "It's given them a huge opportunity to showcase their work and tell stories you wouldn't usually see," added Arjun. Arjun stated that he does not listen to people and takes his own decisions.

49.title: One needs to have big heart to say sorry: Kapri on Akshay's Tobacco firm ad note
49.article_body: After actor Akshay Kumar issued statement, apologising for appearing in an advertisement for Vimal Elaichi, filmmaker Vinod Kapri took to Twitter to say, "Sorry is just a word but one needs to have a big heart to say it." Actress Juhi Chawla also reacted to Akshay's post and wrote, "Respect." YouTuber Maxtern wrote, "Love you sir."

50.title: Forest officials rescue endangered narrow-headed turtle
50.article_body: Indian Forest Service officer Parveen Kaswan took to Twitter to share video of a narrow-headed softshell turtle being rescued on Wednesday. The video shows officials taking the endangered animal in a vehicle to a water body where it is freed from the net and released into the water. They were lauded by Twitter users for their work.

51.title: Boy in Brazil born with 2 penises in 1-in-5 million defect, extra penis removed
51.article_body: A boy in Brazil was born with two penises in one-in-five million defect known as diphallia. Doctors at Federal University of Sao Paulo originally planned on removing the two-year-old boy's right penis, however, they surgically removed the left penis after his mother revealed he could only urinate from his right. The first known case of diphallia was recorded in 1609.

52.title: What I say doesn't matter: Abhishek on the things he learnt from Big B
52.article_body: Talking about the things he has learnt from dad and actor Amitabh Bachchan, actor Abhishek Bachchan said, "What I say does not matter but what I do on screen matters immensely." Discussing 'The Kashmir Files', Abhishek stated that the film's success is very heartening for Bollywood. "It doesn't matter who is on the poster," added Abhishek.

53.title: Wheat stubble burning cases up 3 times from last year in Punjab: Data
53.article_body: Punjab has recorded 152 cases of wheat stubble burning, including 56 on a single day (April 20), so far in April, as per Punjab Pollution Control Board's data. The number is three times more than 2021 and 11 times more than 2020 for the corresponding period. Moga and Patiala districts reported the highest number of such incidents at 20 each.

54.title: Ankush Shinde appointed as new Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner
54.article_body: IPS officer Ankush Shinde has been appointed as the new Commissioner of Pimpri-Chinchwad Police. He will replace Krishna Prakash, who has been transferred to Mumbai as special inspector general of police (VIP security). Also, Sandeep Karnik has been appointed as the joint commissioner of police for Pune City and will succeed Dr Ravindra Shisve.

55.title: Decomposed body of 31-yr-old woman found in Bengaluru; husband held
55.article_body: The body of a 31-year-old woman was found in a decomposed state at her residence in Bengaluru on Wednesday night. The victim's husband, Ashok, has been arrested. The police were alerted after neighbours got a foul smell emanating from the house. As per the police, the accused had killed his wife on April 17 and then locked the house.

56.title: Boxer Amir Khan robbed of ₹72-lakh watch at gunpoint in London, CCTV footage surfaces
56.article_body: Boxer Amir Khan was robbed of a ₹72-lakh watch at gunpoint in London on Monday evening. A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing hooded thugs stopping Amir near his car. "In UK...the law is quite strong where hardly anyone, even the police, don't really carry guns. So, it was quite shocking to see a gun pointed at me," Amir said.

57.title: Consider working at Boring Company: Musk as his company raises $675 mn
57.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted, "Please consider working at The Boring Company! Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth." Musk tweeted this after his company, which builds tunnels for vehicles to avoid traffic, raised $675 million in funding at a $5.675 billion valuation. "Purpose is to recruit amazing people," The Boring Company tweeted.

58.title: Mumbai Police couple raises ₹56 lakh to treat rare disease of son
58.article_body: A Mumbai Police couple has raised ₹56 lakh for the treatment of their four-year-old son suffering from a rare disease called Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA Type-III). The boy reportedly faced problems while crawling, sitting and walking amid the medical condition. According to the couple, industrialist Ratan Tata funded ₹49 lakh, while the rest of the amount was raised through crowdfunding.

59.title: Heavy vehicle owner issued e-challan grabs Mumbai constable by collar
59.article_body: The owner of two heavy vehicles grabbed head constable, Sharad Chaudhary, by his collar and manhandled him after he was issued an e-challan. Chaudhary and his colleague were identifying heavy vehicles to issue e-challans during peak hours when the owner of vehicles asked them not to issue a challan. While e-challan was issued to one vehicle, another managed to escape.

60.title: $54 billion wiped off Netflix's market value in its biggest drop since 2004
60.article_body: Netflix shares crashed 35% on Wednesday, wiping off $54 billion from the company's market value in its biggest drop since 2004. It made Netflix the worst-performing stock of the year on both S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 indexes. Netflix shares crashed after it reported losing 2,00,000 subscribers in Q1 2022, marking the first drop in subscribers in over 10 years.

61.title: Govt shares names of fastest growing major economies in world, India tops list
61.article_body: Government has shared the names of some of the fastest growing major world economies and said, "As India marches on a high-growth trajectory, the country is set to remain the fastest growing economy in the world." India tops list with 8.2% GDP growth projection by IMF. China has a growth projection of 4.4%, while US and UK are at 3.7%.

62.title: Shehnaaz visits her hometown in Punjab; shares video of riding on horse cart
62.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill shared a vlog to show a glimpse of how she spent a day in her village in Punjab. In the video, Shehnaaz is standing nearby a crop field, where she is seen clicking selfies with kids and treating them with ice-creams. She later took a horse cart ride to reach her house.

63.title: Glad they don't remember: Ayushmann on actors being rude to him
63.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said there were a "lot" of times when actors were "rude" to him while interviewing them in the past, adding he is glad they don't remember as it would have been "embarrassing" for them. "Most of the actors, they don't care sometimes," stated Ayushmann. Ayushmann recently completed 10 years in Bollywood with 'Vicky Donor' being his debut film.

64.title: BJP turned K'taka into corruption capital of country: Congress' Shivakumar
64.article_body: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Wednesday alleged that BJP-led state government has transformed Karnataka into "corruption capital of the country". He further claimed that the government had failed to bring justice to contractor Santosh Patil. "They are...protecting the accused (KS Eshwarappa)," he said. Shivakumar earlier demanded Eshwarappa's arrest in the alleged suicide of Santosh Patil.

65.title: Stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps: Kajal Aggarwal on struggles after giving birth
65.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, who recently gave birth to her son Neil, took to Instagram to pen a note. "Our birthing was exhilarating, overwhelming, long, yet the most satisfying experience there could be!" she wrote. "Of course it's not been easy- 3 sleepless nights, learning to latch and burp, squishy bellies and stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps," she added.

66.title: Rohit got exaggerated with his reactions vs LSG, that's not good: Hogg
66.article_body: Discussing MI's defeat against LSG, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "[MI captain] Rohit Sharma got exaggerated with his reactions when there was a dropped catch." "Rohit put his hands on the head and fell on the ground after an overthrow off Jasprit Bumrah's bowling," added Hogg. "That's not good when you are trying to establish a culture," stated Hogg.

67.title: Largest crypto exchange Binance limits services in Russia
67.article_body: World's largest crypto exchange Binance is limiting services for Russian nationals or entities that have crypto assets exceeding €10,000, following the EU's latest sanctions against Russia. Russian nationals or legal entities in Russia who have crypto account balances that exceed €10,000 will be given 90 days to close their positions. Affected accounts will be put into a withdrawal-only mode.

68.title: Nestle India's profit falls to ₹595 cr in Q1 2022 amid high inflation
68.article_body: Nestle India's profit in the January-March 2022 quarter fell marginally to ₹594.7 crore. "As highlighted in previous quarters, costs of key raw and packaging materials are witnessing 10-year highs and costs continued to surge this quarter which has impacted profit from operations," Nestle said. Its revenue rose 10.2% YoY to ₹3,980.7 crore while its operating margin fell 200 basis points.

69.title: They are not batting sensibly: Harbhajan on PBKS scoring 115 vs DC
69.article_body: Reacting to PBKS' defeat against DC by 9 wickets having been bowled out for 115, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said PBKS shouldn't forget the basics of the game. "Whenever you lose wickets, there needs to be a partnership through sensible batting which they aren't doing at the moment," added Harbhajan. "Net run rate (NRR) will definitely hurt them," stated Harbhajan.

70.title: 20-yr-old Chandigarh girl bags International Master title in chess
70.article_body: Tarini Goyal, a 20-year-old chess player from Chandigarh, bagged the International Master title at Budapest's Vezerkepzo International Master becoming India’s 43rd Woman International Master (WIM). This is Tarini’s third WIM norm. She won her first two mandatory norms at World Youth Chess Championship in Greece (2018) and Abu Dhabi (2019). “The third...title has come after much wait,” Tarini said.

71.title: Burglars trigger gelatin blast at ATM in Pimpri Chinchwad, fail to rob cash
71.article_body: In an attempt to rob an ATM kiosk in Pimpri Chinchwad, two people on Thursday morning allegedly triggered a blast with the help of gelatin sticks. However, "they couldn't break open the cash box", police said. "Some people, who...were alerted because of...blast, came to the spot and even tried to chase the burglars but they managed to flee," police added.

72.title: Best time to invest in India as govt committed to economic reforms: Anurag Thakur
72.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that it is the best time to invest in India as the central government is committed to carrying out deep economic reforms going forward. When the world was struggling, India was busy strengthening its foundation for the post-pandemic world, he added. During the pandemic, 47 unicorns were born in India, he further said.

73.title: US Capitol evacuated after parachute demonstration triggers false alarm
73.article_body: The US Capitol was briefly evacuated on Wednesday after police identified an aircraft as "a probable threat". Later, it was found that the plane was military aircraft carrying parachutists for a demonstration at a baseball stadium. Calling it an "outrageous mistake", House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the Federal Aviation Administration had failed to inform Capitol Police of the pre-planned flyover.

74.title: If Pollard is not bowling, then MI got to look at his scores: Manjrekar
74.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has questioned Kieron Pollard's place in MI's playing XI, stating that the team needs to look at his contribution if the 34-year-old is playing as a batter. "Pollard has to bowl at least three overs...if he's not bowling...[then] I think [MI] got to look at scores," stated Manjrekar. Pollard has scored 82 runs in six games.

75.title: EU panel backs proposal for common worldwide phone charger port
75.article_body: A European Parliament committee on Wednesday backed a proposal suggesting the adoption of a common charging port for a range of mobile gadgetry including phones, tablets, low-powered laptops and headphones. Chargers for portable devices shipped to Europe generate 11,000 to 13,000 tonnes of e-waste every year, a Parliamentarian said. An assembly vote over the proposal will take place next month.

76.title: Imran Khan govt fell due to strained ties with ‘establishment’: Ex-minister
76.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan-led government was ousted as its relations with the "establishment" were strained, said PTI leader and ex-minister Fawad Chaudhry. "Had our [relationship] with the establishment been good, we would have still been in the government," he said. This comes amid rumours of discord between Pakistan's army and the former government.

77.title: Wear masks in buses, cinema halls, schools, offices: Punjab govt as COVID cases rise
77.article_body: As COVID-19 cases rise in the country, the Punjab government has asked people to wear masks in crowded places. "Wearing of masks should be specially ensured in closed environments like buses, trains, taxis, cinema halls, shopping malls, departmental stores, schools, offices and indoor gatherings," the notice issued by the government read.

78.title: Man shot twice by fellow moviegoer during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening in Karnataka
78.article_body: A man, in his 20s, was shot twice by a fellow moviegoer during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening in Karnataka's Haveri district. The incident happened after a quarrel erupted between the two after the man reportedly kept his leg on the front seat on which the accused was sitting. The man was taken to a hospital, where he is currently recuperating.

79.title: Will be blessing if I can kick like you in few yrs: Tiger on Big B trying kicks
79.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff shared pictures of actor Amitabh Bachchan trying flexible kicks. "Sir if I still can kick like you even...few years later, it will be a blessing," Tiger wrote. "Seeing Tiger Shroff getting...'like' numbers through his flexible kick abilities...I thought I would also give it a try...in hope of getting...small percentage of 'likes'," Bachchan had written in a post.

80.title: US announces $48 million aid for Afghan refugees in Pakistan
80.article_body: The United States has announced an assistance package of over $48 million for Afghan refugees living in Pakistan. The aid is meant for "Afghan refugees and host communities" in Pakistan, said the US embassy in Pakistan. It added that following the latest aid, the total assistance the US has provided reached up to $262 million.

81.title: 8-yr-old black boy cries as he is detained for stealing in US; people call it 'traumatic'
81.article_body: After a video showing officers detaining an 8-year-old boy for apparently stealing a packet of chips sparked outrage, US' Syracuse Police Department said, "The incident is being reviewed." In the video, a man can be heard saying, "Why are you treating the boy like a cold-blooded criminal." People called the video which showed the child crying "traumatic".

82.title: NASA shares video of solar eclipse on Mars that lasted 40 secs
82.article_body: NASA has shared a video of a solar eclipse on Mars taken by its Perseverance rover that shows Mars' moon Phobos crossing the face of the Sun. The eclipse, captured on April 2, lasted a little over 40 seconds. Phobos, which is about 157 times smaller than Earth's moon, is one of Mars' two natural satellites.

83.title: Centre working on national database on internal security: Amit Shah
83.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said the Centre is working on a national database related to internal security covering terror funding, bomb blasts, narcotics, fake currency, hawala and terrorism. The database will help the central agencies and police in states and UTs in investigations, Shah added while speaking at the 13th National Investigation Agency (NIA) Day programme.

84.title: It was a tough one, a day to forget for us: Mayank on defeat vs DC
84.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said it was a day to forget for them as they lost by nine wickets against DC. "We didn't bat and bowl well, we just need to move on...We've been losing too many wickets too early, that's a concern," he added. PBKS are placed eighth on the points table after losing four of their seven games.

85.title: Tell Centre not to harass industrialists: Mamata to Guv Dhankhar
85.article_body: Addressing people during Bengal Global Business Summit in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee urged Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar to tell the central government not to "harass" industrialists through central agencies. She also thanked Dhankhar for attending the event and said, "I am happy that the Governor joined me here. We appreciate your support. Please always keep doing so."

86.title: 32-year-old worker killed in blast at firecracker unit in Tamil Nadu
86.article_body: A 32-year-old man was killed in a blast at a firecracker unit in Tamil Nadu's Sivakasi on Wednesday. According to reports, S Aravindswamy was working inside the factory at the time of the blast and got trapped under debris. Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin expressed condolences and announced a relief amount of ₹3 lakh for the deceased's family.

87.title: US judge rejects 'gag order' for Musk in 2018 Tesla tweets case
87.article_body: A US judge has ruled Tesla CEO Elon Musk will not be subjected to a "gag order" in a lawsuit against his 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private. He said no proof was found that letting Musk talk posed a danger to a trial. Shareholders had asked for the order after Musk recently discussed the case at a TED conference.

88.title: Nigerian drug peddler held in Delhi's Dwarka, heroin worth ₹2.70 cr seized
88.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested a 29-year-old Nigerian drug peddler from Dwarka under operation 'Varchasva'. Police also seized high quality heroin worth ₹2.70 crore from his possession. "Based on a secret tip, a team was prepared under the leadership of ACP Vijay Singh and SI Subhas for the arrest of this foreign national," DCP Shankar Choudhary said.

89.title: UK Queen Elizabeth gets her own Barbie doll for Platinum Jubilee
89.article_body:
Britain's Queen Elizabeth II is being honoured with a Barbie doll to mark her Platinum Jubilee this year. Elizabeth, who turned 96 on Thursday, ascended the throne on February 6, 1952, after her father, King George VI's death. She's the longest-ruling monarch in British history.
The doll will be sold ahead of the official Platinum Jubilee celebrations in early June.

90.title: Stretched skin, frozen pads & breast pumps: Kajal on postpartum struggles
90.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal took to Instagram on Thursday to share a note about the birth of her son Neil. Speaking about her experience of becoming a mother and her postpartum struggles, Kajal wrote, "Elated to welcome my baby Neil into this world...of course, it's not been easy...Stretched skin, frozen pads, breast pumps...all topped with dozes of anxiety."

91.title: Mumbai's BEST to go digital; Aaditya Thackeray launches tap-in tap-out service
91.article_body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray inaugurated tap-in tap-out service for Mumbai’s BEST (Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport) on Wednesday, making it city's first bus to go fully digital. “Inaugurated tap-in tap-out service on Gateway of India to Churchgate route...We’ll be implementing this in all 10 buses on this route...and expand it on all 438 routes,” Thackeray tweeted.

92.title: 3 men held for stalking & harassing 2 female college students in Punjab
92.article_body: Three men were arrested from Punjab’s Anandpur Sahib for stalking and harassing two female college students. While the girls were returning to their college on Sunday evening, the accused started following them in a car, police said. Two of them passed vulgar comments and threw ₹20 notes at the girls, prompting them to record the men on video, police added.

93.title: Bulldozer represents the arbitrary order: Congress' P Chidambaram
93.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said the bulldozer represents the "arbitrary order". His remark came in reaction to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area. "Once arbitrary orders override law, we are on the road to hell," Chidambaram tweeted. "The Supreme Court represents ‘law’. Yesterday, we saw the bulldozer defy the law. Let’s see what happens today," he added.

94.title: DC share video of David Warner screaming 'How's the josh?' in dressing room after win
94.article_body: DC took to Instagram to share a video of opener David Warner screaming 'How's the josh?' in the dressing room following their nine-wicket victory over Punjab Kings (PBKS). In the video, DC players can be heard responding to Warner with 'High sir!' after which Warner can be seen saluting. DC are currently sixth on the IPL 2022 points table.

95.title: How does Kohli's performance in first 7 matches of IPL 2022 compare with other seasons?
95.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli has scored 119 runs in the first seven matches of IPL 2022. It is the least amount of runs Kohli has got in the first seven matches of any IPL season. Kohli scored 122 runs in the first seven matches of inaugural IPL, while he scored 433 runs in the first seven matches of IPL 2016.

96.title: I was 2 when I 1st faced camera, never got to watch that video: Actress Wamiqa
96.article_body: Actress Wamiqa Gabbi said she first faced the camera when she was only two years old. "I first faced camera for shooting music video. However, I never got to watch that video as it is not available online or anywhere for that matter," she added. She further said she got involved in theatre and took part in plays in school.

97.title: Fraudster in police uniform video calls Mumbai man, cheats him of ₹3 lakh
97.article_body: A 26-year-old Mumbai man was allegedly cheated of ₹3 lakh after he received a video call from a gang of fraudsters in which one was wearing police uniform. As per the complainant, the fraudsters convinced him that his documents were misused by a criminal and he needed to register a case for which he will have to pay money.

98.title: K'taka Cong MLA slaps man who asked him to fix roads in village
98.article_body: Congress MLA from Pavagada, Venkataramanappa, slapped a person who asked him to fix roads and solve water problems in his village, Nagennahalli on Wednesday. A video of the incident, that took place near the tehsildar's office in Pavagada, went viral on social media. "This is how CONgress addresses the problems faced by Citizens," BJP Karnataka wrote on Twitter.

99.title: Whenever there are anti-terror ops, rights groups raise issue: Shah
99.article_body: Calling terrorism the biggest cause of human rights violations, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that the human rights groups raise issues whenever anti-terror operations are conducted. "It's imperative to eradicate terrorism from its roots to safeguard human rights," he added. Shah was speaking at the 13th National Investigation Agency (NIA) Day programme in Delhi.

100.title: We know how to get out of it: Bravo on CSK losing 5 of their 6 games
100.article_body: Talking about their five defeats in six games in the ongoing IPL season, CSK all-rounder Dwayne Bravo said they know "how to get out of it". "It can easily go haywire if it's a different franchise...teams get divided and there's outside pressure and noise. But with CSK there's none of that," he added. CSK are placed ninth on points table.

101.title: Mumbai woman says stranger added her as loan guarantor twice, police responds
101.article_body: A woman took to Twitter to share screenshot of a message, while also claiming she has been added as a loan guarantor twice by a person she does not know. "Even after informing him not to add...[he is] still doing the same...@MumbaiPolice @ThaneCityPolice...please take action against him," she wrote. Mumbai Police asked her to report issue at nearest police station.

102.title: Ministry of Home Affairs reshuffles 42 officers across AGMUT cadre
102.article_body: In a reshuffle of AGMUT (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and Union Territories) cadre officers, the Ministry of Home Affairs has transferred 42 officers to and from Delhi and other Union Territories. Among these are two DCPs who were heading the Special Investigation Teams set up to investigate Northeast Delhi riot cases.

103.title: 4 arrested for cheating finance company of ₹4.6 crore in Gujarat
103.article_body: Ahmedabad Police's DCB arrested four persons for allegedly cheating a finance company of ₹4.6 crore which they had sought to purchase land on behalf of unsuspecting customers. According to police, Parbat Rabari, owner of a builder company, Rishabh Yagnik, the then general manager at the loan finance company, Kalpesh Prajapati, a valuer and Dilip Shah, a broker were arrested.

104.title: Russian ICBM test 'routine' and 'not a threat', says US
104.article_body: Russia "properly" notified the US ahead of its test launch of the intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), the Pentagon said, adding the test was "routine" and "not a threat to the US or its allies". On Wednesday, Russia conducted a first test launch of its Sarmat ICBM. Russian President Vladimir Putin has said the missile can hit any target on Earth.

105.title: Apple store workers in Atlanta file for firm's 1st US union election
105.article_body: Workers at an Apple store in Atlanta have filed for a union election with the NLRB. If a majority of the workers vote to unionise, the store would be the first unionised US Apple store. "We want to make sure...every Apple worker is able to afford quality housing and basic living expenses," an Apple worker said.

106.title: Lack of coordination among NDA led to BJP's defeat in Bochahan bypoll: JD(U) leader
106.article_body: JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said that "lack of coordination among NDA partners" led to the recent defeat of BJP in Bochahan assembly seat by-election in Bihar. "The BJP's central leadership should intervene and consider the JD(U)'s long-standing demand for a coordination committee in Bihar," he added. RJD candidate Amar Kumar Paswan won the Bochahan election by margin of 36,617 votes.

107.title: Military hospitals, cantonments to get Ayurveda centres: Govt
107.article_body: The ministries of Defence and Ayush have agreed to set up Ayurveda centres at 12 military hospitals and 37 cantonments across the country. The centres will come up in Agra, Dalhousie, Jhansi, Jammu, Jalandhar and Delhi. The MoUs were signed during the Global Ayush Investment and Innovation Summit in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, which was attended by PM Narendra Modi.

108.title: Supreme Court halts Jahangirpuri demolition drive for 2 weeks
108.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed demolition drive in Jahangirpuri for two weeks, saying, "We will take a serious view of all demolitions that took place after the status quo order was communicated to the mayor." On Wednesday, the demolition, which started around 10.15 am, went on for two hours despite SC's directions at 11 am that status quo be maintained.

109.title: Fraudsters impersonate Tripura minister, ask for money on WhatsApp
109.article_body: Unknown fraudsters reportedly impersonated Tripura Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury and tried to con his contacts. The racketeers reportedly asked for money from his contacts, including several officials through WhatsApp messages. "The cyber-crime unit of the Tripura Police...is investigating the issue," a statement issued by Chowdhury's office said.

110.title: Video of woman giving birth in torchlight in Odisha goes viral, probe on
110.article_body: A probe was initiated after a video of a woman giving birth under the torchlight of a mobile phone due to power outage in Odisha's Ganjam district went viral. “Delivery could not have been delayed...I had to conduct the delivery under a cellphone torch as there was no generator or inverter facility available at the CHC," Dr Pragyan Prathama said.

111.title: Tripura govt announces health insurance scheme for journalists
111.article_body: Tripura government on Wednesday approved a health insurance scheme of ₹3 lakh for accredited journalists associated with print, web and electronic media organisations. According to Information and Cultural Affairs Minister Sushanta Chowdhury, journalists in the age group of 21-65 years will be considered eligible for the scheme. At present, Tripura has 177 accredited journalists, Chowdhury said.

112.title: It wasn't with Anurag Kashyap, speculation unethical: Mandana on 'secret relationship'
112.article_body: After revealing on 'Lock Upp' that she was in a secret relationship with a director following her split with husband, Mandana Karimi said that it wasn't with Anurag Kashyap as being speculated. "How can people play with names...It's not done. It's very unethical and unfortunate," she said. Mandana added that she and Anurag are friends.

113.title: When I'd try to leave, she'd scream 'I am going to die': Depp on ex-wife Amber Heard
113.article_body: While testifying in defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, actor Johnny Depp said, "Many times when I'd try to leave, she'd stop me, cry and scream." He added, "[She'd say] 'I can't live without you. I am going to die'." Depp added that Amber would follow him when he'd leave and scream in his parking lot.

114.title: UK PM tries his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat
114.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson tried his hands on charkha at Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat as he arrived in India for a two-day visit. "It is an immense privilege to come to the Ashram of this extraordinary man, and to understand how he mobilised such simple principles of truth and non-violence to change the world for the better," he wrote.

115.title: CSK, MI don't have top-order bowlers, that's why they're at the bottom: Ajay Jadeja
115.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said the lack of "top-order" bowlers has been one of the reasons why both CSK and MI are at the bottom of IPL points table. "CSK are not known for making many changes. An out-and-out fast bowler could have helped, but it's late now," he added. MI are winless in their six games in IPL 2022.

116.title: They threatened to enter my bedroom: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife on video of Sharif's supporters
116.article_body: Supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif threatened to enter the bedroom of Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith during a protest in London. Jemima shared a video on Twitter and wrote, "What is this protestor on the right outside my mother's house miming after threatening to enter my bedroom?"

117.title: Not sure how it got through review: Binance on its swastika-like emoji
117.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance took to Twitter to react to the issue surrounding an emoji it unveiled earlier, saying, "Well that was...really embarrassing. We're not sure how that emoji got through...layers of review without anyone noticing." Several users had pointed out the emoji's resemblance to swastika symbol used by Nazis. "We immediately flagged the issue, pulled it down," Binance added.

118.title: Woman gets calls seeking sexual favours as 3 men write number on K'taka toilet walls
118.article_body: A woman received over 500 calls seeking sexual favours after three of her colleagues scribbled her contact number and email address on the walls of public toilets and bus stands in many places in Karnataka. The accused had also sent obscene WhatsApp messages to the victim. A lecturer is among those arrested by the police.

119.title: I would like to do a comedy film with dad: Shraddha on Shakti Kapoor
119.article_body: Shraddha Kapoor said she wants to do a movie with her father-actor Shakti Kapoor and also added that she'd like to do a comedy film with him. She said, "He's constantly making us laugh in the house. It would be lovely to share screen space with him." Shraddha added that she is very inspired by her father and his work.

120.title: 23 of 105 parties eligible to encash electoral bonds: RTI response
120.article_body: Of the 105 political parties that submitted data regarding receiving electoral bonds to the ECI, 23 are eligible to receive and encash these, data shared under the RTI Act stated. In response to an RTI application, SBI said only 23 political parties have opened a special current account made for redeeming and encashing electoral bonds as of March this year.

121.title: Mathura temple shuts loudspeakers after UP govt order
121.article_body: Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi temple complex in UP's Mathura decided to switch off the loudspeakers after the state government issued directives on the use of sound systems at religious places. All 'bhajans' and 'kirtans' (prayers) will now be played at low levels so that the sound does not go beyond the complex, said a temple official.

122.title: Those criticising PM are premature babies born in 3rd month: Bhagyaraj
122.article_body: Actor Bhagyaraj called the people criticising Prime Minister Narendra Modi "premature babies born in the third month of pregnancy". "Why we should think that they were born in the third month is because...in fourth month...mouth is formed...and ear is formed...in fifth month. I call these people premature babies...because they will neither talk good nor listen to good things," he added.

123.title: I moved to Mumbai, thought 'why does everyone love SRK, why don't I': Shehnaaz
123.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill said that when she moved to Mumbai, she wondered why everyone loves actor Shah Rukh Khan. "I wondered why don't I love him...I watched his films and then I became his fan," she said, adding that she used to live in her own world while she was in Punjab before moving to Mumbai.

124.title: Please consider working at Boring Company: Musk as it raises $675 mn
124.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded to his startup The Boring Company raising $675 million at a valuation of nearly $6 billion, saying, "Please consider working at The Boring Company!" "Our goal is to solve traffic, which plagues every major city on Earth," he added. The startup's funding was led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital.

125.title: Owaisi has Jinnah's DNA, believes in Sharia law: Giriraj Singh
125.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi for comparing Delhi's Jahangirpuri anti-encroachment drive with Turkman Gate incident during the Emergency and said that leaders like Owaisi view all issues through "Hindu versus Muslim angle". "They do so because they have Jinnah's DNA and believe in Sharia law, not the law of the land," Singh added.

126.title: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla inaugurates 4 India-Vietnam flights
126.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Wednesday inaugurated four new flights between India and Vietnam. These flights will help boost the economies of both the countries and increase business and tourism opportunities, Birla said. The new flights will operate between Hanoi, Ho Chi Minh City and Mumbai as well as from Phu Quoc to New Delhi and Mumbai.

127.title: 6 people killed as plane crashes onto busy Haitian street
127.article_body: At least six people, including the pilot, have been killed after a small plane crashed onto a busy street in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on Wednesday, officials said. The plane had reportedly crashed due to an engine failure. Haitian PM Ariel Henry said he was saddened by the crash and offered his sympathies to the families of the victims.

128.title: Rohit Sharma is not going through a bad patch like Kohli: Manjrekar
128.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said that MI captain Rohit Sharma is "hitting good 20s and whenever he plays he looks in good touch". He added, "[Rohit's lack of runs] is not a bad patch like Virat Kohli's, who's not looking in good form. Rohit's machinery looks in top condition but then he gets out suddenly."

129.title: 2 owners of Gurugram guest house booked for using Ex-DCP's forged signature
129.article_body: Police have booked two owners of a guest house in Gurugram for using forged signature of former DCP-East Maqsood Ahmed in the facility's arrival-departure register. The matter came to light when  police personnel found Ahmed's signature on a certificate pasted on the first page of the register. On further investigation, the police found out the certificate to be fake.

130.title: Surprised that the no. 3 spot has been a rolling chair for LSG: Jaffer
130.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he is "surprised" to see that the number three position has been a "rolling chair" for LSG. "Sometimes Manish Pandey [bats] at that spot, Krishnappa Gowtham came against RR and Jason Holder was promoted to that spot as well," added Jaffer. "LSG have not used Ayush Badoni well in the last few matches," stated Jaffer.

131.title: Taiwan says 11 Chinese warplanes entered its air defence zone
131.article_body: Taiwan on Wednesday said that as many as 11 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. In response, Taiwan dispatched its air patrol forces, issued radio warnings and deployed air defence missile systems to monitor the activities of the intruding aircraft, said the country's defence ministry in a statement. The ministry also released a list of the aircraft.

132.title: My kids just want to know why I don't score a hundred: David Warner
132.article_body: On being asked what his kids tell him after he gets out, DC opener David Warner said, "They just want to know why I don't score a hundred." "They keep watching Jos Buttler score hundreds. They ask me, 'Why can't you hit the ball out of the park like him?'" Warner added. Warner has hit three consecutive fifties in IPL.

133.title: 4 US Amazon drivers sue firm over being stuck in warehouse amid tornado
133.article_body: Four US Amazon drivers have sued the firm after they sustained injuries while they were stuck in a warehouse amid a tornado in December. Amazon allegedly threatened to fire employees who tried to leave the facility and seek shelter at home. A separate lawsuit was filed on behalf of the mother of deceased worker DeAndre Morrow.

134.title: State-sponsored targeting of minorities: Rahul on Jahangirpuri demolition drive
134.article_body: Reacting to the demolition drive in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri area, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that the act was a “state-sponsored targeting of poor and minorities”. "This is demolition of India’s constitutional values…BJP must bulldoze the hatred in their hearts instead," Gandhi added. Meanwhile, Congress’ Shashi Tharoor said that the demolition drive was "illegal".

135.title: Mango sticky rice sales sharply rise in Thailand as rapper eats it on stage in US
135.article_body: Thai rapper Milli's performance has led to a sharp rise in mango sticky rice sales in Thailand after she ate it on stage at California's Coachella festival. The 19-year-old rapper became the first Thai to perform solo at Coachella festival. Thai government said it may send a proposal for the rice to be listed as a UNESCO cultural heritage item.

136.title: 1 dead, 4 injured as electric scooter battery explodes in room in T'gana
136.article_body: An 80-year-old man died and four others were injured after an electric scooter battery exploded while being charged at their home in Telangana's Nizamabad, police said. The deceased and two others were sleeping in the room where the battery exploded, police added. A case was registered against a Hyderabad-based startup that had manufactured the scooter and the dealer, police stated.

137.title: Man sentenced to death for rape, murder of 7-yr-old girl in Bhiwandi
137.article_body: Thane Sessions Court on Wednesday sentenced a 30-year-old man to death for raping and killing a seven-year-old girl. The incident occurred in December 2019 when the accused, who was known to the deceased, kidnapped her and took her to a secluded place in Bhiwandi. He then raped the girl and smashed her head with a stone.

138.title: I'm enjoying my bowling after a long time and credit goes to Pant: Kuldeep
138.article_body: DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who's currently the second-highest wicket-taker in the ongoing IPL season with 13 wickets in six games, has said he's enjoying his bowling after a long time. "The credit...goes to Rishabh Pant for the way he backs his spinners. This gives a lot of confidence...I've been given a lot of confidence in this IPL," he stated.

139.title: Mumbai woman tweets about neighbour molesting elder daughter, tags police
139.article_body: A Mumbai woman took to Twitter to say that her elder daughter was molested my her neighbour on March 28. "After spending more than 6 hours in Bandra Police Station, no FIR filed on my complaint...There after I gave...written complaint to DCP sir and ACP sir, till date no action," she wrote. She tagged Mumbai Police Commissioner in tweet.

140.title: 72 foreigners held for involvement in narcotics trade in HP from 2017-21: Police data
140.article_body: From 2017 to 2021, a total of 72 foreign nationals have been arrested for their involvement in the narcotics trade in Himachal Pradesh, according to state police data. During this period, half of the total foreign nationals arrested for involvement in illegal drugs smuggling in the state are from Nigeria, according to the data.

141.title: Used to be 90 kgs before my acting debut; I was very self-conscious: Sonia
141.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Broken But Beautiful 3', revealed she was overweight before making her acting debut and worked extremely hard to get in shape. She said, "I used to be 90 kgs and...[was] very self-conscious." "I worked on myself...took acting classes, got roles in off-broadway plays and became a full-time actress in New York first," she added.

142.title: 4 labourers kill co-worker, dump body in drain in Pune; arrested
142.article_body: Police arrested four labourers in Pune for allegedly killing their colleague and dumping his body in a drain in a gunny bag, with his limbs tied together. The men were reportedly drinking in a room when a fight broke out and the victim was beaten to death. Police arrested the accused on Tuesday after the body was found on Monday.

143.title: G20 members walk out of meeting over Russia’s participation
143.article_body: Several members walked out of a G20 meeting held in Washington DC over the participation of Russia against the backdrop of the Ukraine war. The representatives from the US, Ukraine, Britain, France and Canada boycotted the meeting when Russian officials started to speak. Many of the members attending the meeting virtually turned off their cameras.

144.title: Amazon, SpaceX, others bag $278.5 mn in NASA communications deal
144.article_body: Amazon's Project Kuiper, SpaceX's Starlink network and four others have won a combined $278.5 million in contracts from NASA to begin developing and demonstrating near-Earth space communication services that may support future missions. Kuiper won $67 million, while Starlink received $70 million. Each company is expected to complete the development and demonstrations of its satellites by 2025.

145.title: Accused in attempt to murder case gets bail in MP, asked to plant trees
145.article_body: An accused in an attempt to murder case was granted bail by Gwalior bench of Madhya Pradesh High Court on condition of planting 10 trees. The accused, who said he would do community service voluntarily, must produce pictures of the plants within 30 days and keep the court updated about their health for the next six months, the court said.

146.title: India now identified with minority persecution, Islamophobia: Tharoor
146.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor criticised Centre for carrying out anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and called the action "unconstitutional". "India's image is going downhill...Everything I hear from my friends abroad is deeply negative. We're being identified with minority persecution and Islamophobia," he said. "Government's job is to build up the nation, not bulldoze it down," he added.

147.title: Mother who flung baby girl out of hospital in Mumbai gets life term
147.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was given life imprisonment by a Mumbai court, nearly 12 years after she had flung her baby girl out of a window in KEM Hospital. A security guard, one of witnesses in the case, said that he heard a baby crying and on reaching the spot, he found that the infant's right ear was bleeding.

148.title: Retired colonel, wife found dead in Pune home, bore rifle wounds found
148.article_body: A 75-year-old retired colonel and his 63-year-old wife were found dead in their house in Pune's Mundhwa on Wednesday. Gunshot wounds were also found on their bodies. "The wounds are by a bore rifle...Prima facie it appears that the woman was killed by husband before he shot himself" said Namrata Patil, Deputy Commissioner of Police, zone 5 of Pune police.

149.title: India is indebted to sacrifices of Sikh gurus: Amit Shah
149.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said that the country is indebted to the sacrifices of the Sikh gurus and it is due to their supreme sacrifice that we are a free country today. Shah participated in the celebration of the 400th Parkash Purab of Guru Tegh Bahadur at the Red Fort in Delhi yesterday.

150.title: Mamaearth announces OMG Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer
150.article_body: Mamaearth has announced its OMG (Oh My Goodness) Sale with Buy 1 Get 1 Free offer that's currently live on the Mamaearth app and website. Users can add two of their favourite skincare, haircare, and baby care products to the cart and get one product for free. To avail offer, use coupon code OMG at checkout.

151.title: Ex-national para swimming champ Amartya dies at 19, father says 'Nobody came for help'
151.article_body: Amartya Chakraborty, a three-time former national para swimming champion, passed away aged 19 at a hospital in Delhi. Amartya, who hailed from Salkia in West Bengal's Howrah district, had deformed fingers and suffered from multiple diseases. His father Amitosh said they sought financial help from Paralympic Committee of India and Sports Ministry for Amartya's treatment, but "nobody came for help".

152.title: After 1st film I was all over the place, wasn't easy to digest fame: Ayushmann
152.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that it was difficult for him to digest fame after his first film. "After my first film, I was all over the place...After six-seven months, I realised that you have to give time to your friends and family...I still try my best to strike that balance but it's difficult," he added.

153.title: There's a lot of out of the box thinking: Manjrekar on Pant's captaincy
153.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has praised DC captain Rishabh Pant's leadership after their nine-wicket win over PBKS. Manjrekar pointed out how Pant handled Shardul Thakur after the PBKS batters attacked him, scoring 20 runs off his first two overs, and introduced spinners to take wickets. Pant gave the ball to Lalit Yadav, who dismissed Shikhar Dhawan in the fourth over.

154.title: Bowlers did a fantastic job, made it easier for us: Warner after win vs PBKS
154.article_body: DC opener David Warner said their bowlers did a fantastic job, restricting PBKS to 115 runs. "[Our] bowlers made it easier for us...for me, it's about sticking to the basics and I tried to put my best footwork forward," he added. Warner remained unbeaten at 60 runs to help DC chase down the target in 10.3 overs.

155.title: 2 minor boys drown in pit while taking bath in Gurugram
155.article_body: Two minor boys, aged nine and ten, drowned to death in a pit on Tuesday while taking a bath in Gurugram's Bajghera village, police said. They were brought out by their family members and villagers, and were taken to a hospital but died, police added. One of the victims was a native of Assam and the other of Bihar.

156.title: Jharkhand leaders urge Guv to disqualify BJP MLA over caste certificate
156.article_body: A delegation of Congress, RJD and JMM leaders on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to Jharkhand Governor Ramesh Bais seeking the disqualification of BJP MLA Sammari Lal over his caste certificate. "Since Sammari Lal is a resident of Rajasthan, he is not qualified to get his caste certificate made from Jharkhand," said the memorandum.

157.title: 11-yr-old boy survives landslide by hiding in fridge for 20 hours in Philippines
157.article_body: A Filipino boy survived a landslide by hiding in a refrigerator for 20 hours in what authorities are calling an "absolute miracle". The 11-year-old suffered a broken leg during the ordeal and was taken to a hospital. Authorities said that his mother and younger sibling are still missing, while his father died in another landslide.

158.title: Jersey director said, 'After seeing your dad's shot, nobody will look at you': Shahid
158.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said his film Jersey's director Gowtam Tinnanuri was worried that people will not notice his character in the film because of his father, Pankaj Kapur. "He said, 'After seeing your dad's take, you think anybody is going to look at you...He's so good, he'll pull all the audience, nobody will be interested in you'," Shahid added.

159.title: COVID-19 cases in India see 15% jump over yesterday as 2,380 people test positive
159.article_body: India reported 2,380 COVID-19 cases and 56 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,067 COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 13,433, while the death toll has risen to 5,22,062.

160.title: Nowadays sob stories on reality shows look fake; Boogie Woogie was real: Jaaved
160.article_body: When asked his opinion on reality shows today, actor Jaaved Jaaferi said, "All of them are looking the same. It (the sob stories) looks fake." He added that what made 'Boogie Woogie' stand out was the fact that everything that happened on the show "was organic, real, from the heart and not scripted". "Our reactions would come naturally," he said.

161.title: Elon Musk's Boring Company raises $675 mn at $6 bn valuation
161.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk-led The Boring Company has raised $675 million in a funding round led by Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital. The round has valued the startup at nearly $6 billion. The funding also saw participation from Valor Equity Partners, Founders Fund, 8VC, Craft Ventures, and DFJ Growth. The startup had last raised $120 million three years ago.

162.title: UK PM Boris Johnson arrives in India for two-day visit
162.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Thursday arrived in Ahmedabad for a two-day visit. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and other senior officers welcomed him at the airport. Johnson on Wednesday had said that the visit would deepen the "strategic trade, defence and people-to-people ties between our two countries". Johnson will hold talks with PM Narendra Modi on April 22.

163.title: Kidnapper kills 8-yr-old in Pune's Chikhali after he starts crying, held
163.article_body: A 26-year-old man, identified as Bapil Ahmed Raees Lashkar, was arrested days after dead body of an eight-year-old boy with severe head trauma was found in Pune's Chikhali. The accused, who was a former neighbour of the deceased, had allegedly kidnapped him on April 16 to demand a ransom. After the boy started crying, Lashkar reportedly bludgeoned him to death.

164.title: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani arrested by Assam Police: Congress
164.article_body: Gujarat's Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani was arrested by Assam Police on Wednesday from the Palanpur Circuit House, Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee chief Jagdish Thakor said. "Police took Mevani to Assam by train from Ahmedabad at 4 am," he added. "We have been informed about some case filed against him in Assam," Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar tweeted.

165.title: Bulldozers should be run on BJP headquarters, Amit Shah's residence: Atishi
165.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Atishi took to Twitter to say, "Bulldozers should be run on the BJP headquarters...and on...residence of Amit Shah. After this, riots will not take place in...the country." Meanwhile, Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said, "BJP has created an atmosphere of anarchy in the country." The comments came after demolition drive was carried out in Jahangirpuri.

166.title: Need to be alert about children’s health: CM Yogi as COVID cases surge
166.article_body: As COVID-19 cases surged in parts of Uttar Pradesh, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed the officials to keep a watch on children's health. "We need to be alert with regard to children's health," CM Yogi said in a meeting. He also asked officials to fasten the vaccination process and ensure that COVID protocols are followed in the schools.

167.title: 3 arrested for harassing woman lecturer in Karnataka
167.article_body: Three persons were arrested for allegedly harassing a 58-year-old woman lecturer in Karnataka by writing her contact information on public toilets in several places. The accused, which included a 36-year-old economics lecturer, are also said to have sent obscene WhatsApp messages to the victim. The matter came to light when the woman started getting calls seeking sexual favours.

168.title: Ackman sells $1.1 bn Netflix stock at $400 mn loss after shares fall 35%
168.article_body: Billionaire Bill Ackman has sold his entire stock worth $1.1 billion in Netflix at over $400 million loss three months after acquiring the position. Netflix shares crashed over 35% on Wednesday in their biggest drop since October 2011. "We have lost confidence in our ability to predict the company's future prospects with a sufficient degree of certainty," Ackman said.

169.title: Mumbai man duped of ₹1.44 lakh by fraudster posing as Delhi Police Commissioner
169.article_body: A 71-year-old man from Mumbai was cheated of ₹1.44 lakh by a fraudster posing as Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana. According to police, the victim received a call from the fraudster saying his obscene video had been uploaded on social media and that he would be arrested. The accused and his accomplice then demanded money to delete the said video.

170.title: Shahid's fans will hate me for not supporting him in 'Jersey': Mrunal
170.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming film 'Jersey', which also stars actor Shahid Kapoor, actress Mrunal Thakur said, "Shahid Kapoor's fans will hate me for not supporting him, but the reason will be justified when you watch the film." "There are no similarities between Mrunal and Vidya. A lot of qualities of Vidya are derived from my mother," she added.

171.title: Mumbai man held for using intimate photos of ex-girlfriend to get her business share
171.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 20-year-old man for threatening his ex-girlfriend using her private photos and forcing her to give up her business share. The woman, who is a partner in a pathology lab business, said that he clicked some photos with her earlier and is now threatening to spread them if she didn't agree to give up her profit share.

172.title: Negotiating with Putin is like dealing with a 'crocodile': UK PM ahead of India visit
172.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said it's unlikely that Ukraine and Russia can make peace through negotiations, comparing talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin to dealing with a "crocodile". "How can you negotiate with a crocodile when it's got your leg in its jaws?" Johnson said on a flight to India.

173.title: 2 habitual two-wheeler offenders apprehended in Hyd, 16 bikes seized
173.article_body: Hyderabad's Uppal Police apprehended two habitual two-wheeler offenders and recovered 16 bikes worth ₹6 lakh from them, Rachakonda Police tweeted. The accused persons are classmates and are pursuing intermediate 2nd year, police added. They have been committing thefts since December 2021, police stated. In another case, police arrested two offenders involved in automobile theft.

174.title: Speed up road repair work in 110 villages: BBMP chief to officials
174.article_body: Speed up road repairs in 110 villages where Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board has finished work related to laying water and sanitary lines, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta instructed officials. BBMP has finished restoring 289.69 km of roads, while 505.29 km are still pending, Gupta said. Restoration work must be completed by May-end, he added.

175.title: Priyanka and Nick's baby girl named Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, reveals birth certificate
175.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra and singer Nick Jonas' baby girl has been named Malti Marie Chopra Jonas, as per the birth certificate obtained by TMZ. Priyanka and Nick had welcomed Malti Marie via surrogate on January 15 at a hospital in San Diego, California, the certificate also revealed. The couple announced her birth on January 22.

176.title: DC record their highest-ever score in powerplay in IPL history
