This comes a day after a 40-year-old woman died when a BBMP's garbage truck ran over her, third such fatal incident within a month in Bengaluru. Meanwhile, BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta said that they're working with transport and traffic police department to enhance road safety measures.

352.title: Four-lane service road to come up between Kalindi Kunj, Maharani Bagh
352.article_body: A 6-km-long four-lane service road will come up along the river banks between South Delhi's Maharani Bagh and Kalindi Kunj areas, according to officials. The service roads will help people commuting between Noida and Delhi and will provide relief to residents of densely populated areas like Okhla, Jamia Nagar, Batla House and more, an official said.

353.title: 12 shops gutted in fire at Pune's Kharadi, no casualties reported
353.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that broke out in Pune's Kharadi area on Wednesday, fire officials said. The fire started in one of the shops in the Ubale Nagar area at 10 am, they added. Six fire tenders that were rushed to the spot took one hour to douse the fire. No casualties were reported in the incident.

354.title: Starlink helped restore 10 km of cable connection between villages: Ukraine
354.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has said SpaceX's Starlink helped restore 10 kilometres of cable connection between villages quickly in the Chernihiv region. "It wouldn't be possible to restore 10 km of...connection between villages...after serious battles so quick. Normally it takes few months," he added. Baryshivka-Net resumed the network for five villages with one Starlink.

355.title: Malegaon blast case witness asks MP Police for security, fears going missing
355.article_body: A witness in Malegaon blast case, Jitendra Bhakroda, has asked for security from Madhya Pradesh Police. Reports said that Bhakroda did not appear in the NIA court recently and stated that he fears that he will also go missing like another witness, Dilip Patidar. "Dilip is still missing after...being taken away by Maharashtra's Anti-Terrorism Squad...in November 2008," he said.

356.title: Class 3 boy peeps out of school bus window, dies after head hits pole in UP
356.article_body: A class 3 boy died on Wednesday after his head hit a pole while he was peeping out school bus window in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. "Based on the allegations of laxity levelled by his family against the school, we've taken the authorities for questioning," police said. The family said the school authorities told them that he peeped out to vomit.

357.title: Uber hikes fare rates by 10% in Bengaluru amid rise in fuel prices
357.article_body: Uber has announced a 10% hike in its fare rates in Bengaluru amid a rise in fuel prices. An official said the move was "to help cushion drivers from the impact of a spike in fuel prices", adding it'll continue to track fuel prices and take further steps as needed. Ola is yet to take a decision on hiking fares.

358.title: 12 shops gutted in fire in Pune's Kharadi, no casualty reported
358.article_body: Twelve shops were gutted in a fire that started in Kharadi area of Pune on Wednesday, officials said, adding that no casualties were reported. Six fire tenders were sent to the spot and the fire was doused in one hour. In Kharadi area, several shops are located next to each other and there are some furniture outlets and eateries too.

359.title: 2 mobile phone thieves held in Pune, 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh seized
359.article_body: Two history-sheeters have been arrested for allegedly stealing mobile phones from bus passengers and those waiting at bus stops in Pune and 46 stolen phones worth ₹10 lakh were seized from them. The matter came to light after the duo snatched the mobile phone of a man who had come to a bus stop near Sassoon hospital.

360.title: Nimrat Kaur shares pic of transformation after gaining 15 kg for 'Dasvi'
360.article_body: Nimrat Kaur shared pictures showing her transformation for the film 'Dasvi'. Revealing that she gained around 15 kg, Nimrat wrote that while she relished the process after an initial hesitation, some around her often gave her snide remarks. She concluded by asking people to be more sensitive, while adding, "Make only your mind and body your business. No one else's."

361.title: 13-yr-old girl raped by 80 men in 8 months in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana
361.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was raped by 80 men in eight months at different brothels in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana after she was taken away by a woman. Police identified Sawarna Kumari as the main accused who forced the minor into prostitution. The police, who said they are searching for some more accused, on Tuesday made 10 arrests.

362.title: Hid face from Shweta Tiwari, no one else: Palak on being clicked with Ibrahim
362.article_body: Actress Palak Tiwari said she hid her face from her mother Shweta Tiwari when she was photographed with Ibrahim Ali Khan. "I...told her one hour back that I've left for home...I was like 'mummy there's...so much traffic'...and she was like 'fine'...The second paps came I was like 'mom will see me'...she sent me that picture...said 'you bl***y liar'," Palak added.

363.title: Ranchi woman duped of ₹3.45 lakh on pretext of winning ₹25 lakh lottery, 2 held
363.article_body: Two people were arrested for allegedly duping a 41-year-old woman in Jharkhand's Ranchi. The accused had reached out to her through e-mail, saying she won a lottery of ₹25 lakh and a luxury car, police said. They then asked the woman to pay ₹3.45 lakh to claim the prize money. However,  the duo stopped responding after receiving the money.

364.title: Virat Kohli is overcooked, cannot lose his services with a fried brain: Ravi Shastri
364.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who has scored 119 runs for RCB in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.83, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Kohli is overcooked." He added, "He needs a break because he has got six to seven years of cricket left in him and you don't want to lose that with a fried brain."

365.title: China doubles purchase of Russian coking coal amid discount
365.article_body: China more than doubled imports of coking coal from Russia in March, buying it at a discount as other nations ban Russian imports due to the Russia-Ukraine war. China's coking coal imports from Russia jumped to 1.4 million tonnes in March 2022, compared to 5,50,000 tonnes for March 2021. Coking coal is essential for the production of iron and steel.

366.title: PM Modi gives WHO chief a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai'; his reaction goes viral
366.article_body: While addressing an event in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi gave WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus a Gujarati name 'Tulsibhai', based on the Tulsi herbal plant. The WHO chief, who was sharing the stage with PM Modi, could be seen laughing in the viral video. "He (Tedros) told me 'I'm fully Gujarati now. Give me a Gujarati name'," PM Modi said.

367.title: Switch off bulldozers of hate, switch on power plants: Rahul to PM
367.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "switch off bulldozers of hate and switch on power plants". Gandhi's reference was to the use of bulldozers in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Madhya Pradesh. Referring to the coal shortage issue, Gandhi added, "Modi ji, stagflation is looming. Power cuts will crush small industries, leading to more job losses."

368.title: Pakistan's 1st Sikh police officer allegedly kidnapped by Pak intelligence agencies
368.article_body: BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa in a Twitter post said, "Pakistan media speculates that first Sikh police officer of Pakistan Gulab Singh Shaheen has allegedly been abducted by Pakistan intelligence agencies and taken to some undisclosed place." "We are concerned about his safety and family. Urging High Commission of India in Pakistan to address this issue at earliest," he added.

369.title: COVID-19 situation completely under control in Maharashtra: Health Min Tope
369.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that COVID-19 situation in the state is "completely under control". "I've held a detailed review of COVID-19 situation in the state. There is no need to worry as there has not been a significant rise in cases," he added. "We are vaccinating those in the 12-15 & 15-18 age groups," he further said.

370.title: Xbox head of research & design quits Microsoft after nearly 20 yrs
370.article_body: Xbox's head of research and design Chris Novak has announced that he is leaving Microsoft after nearly 20 years. In his latest role, Novak led the user experience for things like Xbox Game Pass, Xbox Cloud Gaming, and Xbox Live, according to his LinkedIn. At Microsoft, he also held the roles of Design Architect and Design Director.

371.title: Odisha curtails summer vacation for universities, colleges to 16 days
371.article_body: The Odisha government has curtailed summer vacation for all higher education institutions to 16 days in order to compensate for the academic loss due to COVID-19 pandemic. As per order, the summer vacation will be allowed only from June 1 to June 16 this year.  If needed, extra classes should be held on holidays and working days, the order read.

372.title: Centre extends ceasefire agreements with 3 Naga insurgent groups by a year
372.article_body: The Central government has extended the ceasefire agreements signed with three Naga insurgent groups for one more year. The agreements have been established with the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-NK (NSCN-NK), National Socialist Council of Nagaland- Reformation (NSCN-R) and National Socialist Council of Nagaland K-Khango (NSCN K-Khango), the Union Home Ministry said in a statement.

373.title: I was a Miss India but was offered item songs or five-minute glam roles: Sonali
373.article_body: Speaking about her journey in Bollywood, actress Sonali Seygall, who starred in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' said she didn't get any work between her first film and second film. She added. "I was a Miss India. I was...offered item songs or five-minute glam roles." "People...assume...good looking people can't act until you prove yourself as Deepika Padukone did in 'Cocktail'," she said.

374.title: Parts of Pune to not receive water supply on April 21
374.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said there'll be no water supply in some parts of the city on April 21. The affected areas will be Aundh, Baner, ITI Road, Spicer college, Bopodi, Old Mumbai-Pune road, and Anand Park. The water supply will be disrupted because the pipeline near Sindh Society has to be shifted for Pune Metro work, PMC said.

375.title: Punjab Police book Kumar Vishwas, he says Kejriwal will one day betray Punjab CM
375.article_body: Punjab Police have registered a case against Kumar Vishwas for promoting enmity by allegedly making false statements against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Tagging Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, Vishwas tweeted, "I'm warning you that the man sitting in Delhi, whom you are allowing to play with the power given by the people of Punjab, will one day betray you and Punjab."

376.title: Telangana BJP to launch state-wide protests against 'atrocities’ by TRS
376.article_body: The Telangana unit of the BJP has decided to hold state-wide protests on Wednesday against the "atrocities, murders and abetment of suicides by the TRS leaders". This came after a member of the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh, B Sai Ganesh, allegedly killed himself by consuming pesticide in Khammam after accusing TRS leaders of corruption.

377.title: Use masks in closed spaces, advises Karanataka government
377.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi, the Karnataka government has advised the use of face masks at least in closed spaces and indoors to prevent the spread of coronavirus in the state. "Once...cases spike in Delhi, it also tends to increase in other parts...like Bengaluru. It's good for us to exercise caution," Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar said.

378.title: Railways to waterproof Mumbai's AC locals ahead of monsoon
378.article_body: Central Railway will waterproof all Mumbai AC local trains ahead of monsoon to ensure that rain water does not enter the electrical systems placed on the roof of the trains. "Waterproofing is done for additional safety...As the electrical system is not present inside the underslung, minimal waterlogging on tracks will not impact operations," said a senior Central Railway official.

379.title: What's happening with umpiring in IPL 2022, it's quite pathetic: Kris Srikkanth
379.article_body: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth has criticised the umpiring in the ongoing IPL season, stating that it's quite pathetic and "small bad decisions are leading to big outcomes". He added, "Wake up and put some people who actually can be [umpires]." During the RCB-LSG match, Hazlewood's wide delivery wasn't called wide, leading to Marcus Stoinis' wicket on the next ball.

380.title: I was so raw, it's embarrassing: Ayushmann on watching 'Vicky..' after 10 yrs
380.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana watched a scene from his debut film 'Vicky Donor' after ten years. "I was so raw, it's embarrassing," Ayushmann said, adding, "I'm so much better now! I'm seriously watching it after 10 years. I don't watch my films. I only watch them on the edit and maybe on the screening. It's just too much."

381.title: I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's: Jayawardena to troll
381.article_body: After former Sri Lankan cricketer Mahela Jayawardena condemned police in Sri Lanka opening fire at anti-government protesters amid economic crisis, a man tweeted, "Sudden growth of b***s." Responding to the troll, Jayawardena wrote, "I had b***s to fight the system when you were in your father's…so don’t worry about mine. Stay [focussed]."

382.title: Trolling not done, kindly make amends: Ex-cricketer Ganesh to LSG for calling RCB 'beta'
382.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh criticised LSG for calling RCB 'beta' on Twitter. Ahead of LSG-RCB match, LSG had tweeted, "Pesh hain aaj ke Playing XI...RCB beta...tumse na ho payega!" Ganesh tweeted, "Friendly banters are always welcome in cricket. But trolling isn't done. A new team calling a team which's been part of IPL since 2008 Beta...isn't banter. Kindly make amends."

383.title: Shanghai allows 4 mn people to leave their homes as COVID rules ease
383.article_body: China's financial hub Shanghai on Wednesday allowed four million people out of their homes as coronavirus rules in the city eased. Almost 12 million people in the city of 25 million are now allowed to go outdoors following the first round of easing last week, an official said. Shanghai had put most of its population under lockdown on March 28.

384.title: BharatPe appoints Smriti Handa as Chief Human Resources Officer
384.article_body: BharatPe has appointed former Reckitt Global Talent Acquisition Director Smriti Handa as its Chief Human Resources Officer. Handa will work closely with the senior leadership team and focus on strengthening the organisational culture and HR practices, BharatPe said. Handa also held the position of Regional HR Director South Asia at Reckitt.

385.title: He's in jail, yet been named in FIR: Woman on son's name in MP clashes
385.article_body: Sakeena, mother of Shahbaz who has been named in FIR after violence that took place in Madhya Pradesh on Ram Navami, said that her son is already in jail and still has been named in the FIR. "It's being said...he's set motorcycles on fire and has pelted stones...How did he get out of jail to do all this?" she asked.

386.title: How Koreans will become a year younger with change in centuries-old counting method?
386.article_body: South Koreans will become a year younger as country's president-elect Yoon Suk-yeol is planning to abolish a centuries-old method of counting. South Koreans are labeled as one year old at birth and another year is added upon the New Year. The incoming administration is doing this in order to bring South Korea in line with rest of the world.

387.title: Uttarakhand government transfers 22 IAS officers
387.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami-led government transferred 22 Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officers. Former IPS Abhinav Kumar has retained his position as a Special Principal Secretary to the CM again. R Meenakshi Sundaram has been made Secretary to the CM. Radha Raturi has been given the Home Department in the state government.

388.title: Delhi makes face masks mandatory again, ₹500 fine for violators
388.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) on Wednesday decided to make face masks mandatory again for citizens with a fine of ₹500 for violators. This comes after Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that a meeting has been scheduled with the experts and DDMA on April 20. Delhi on Tuesday reported 632 new cases of COVID-19.

389.title: When Kohli hits his straps, final piece of puzzle will be in place for RCB: Hogg
389.article_body: After RCB's win against LSG on Tuesday, former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said the Faf Du Plessis-led side is quickly becoming the favourites in the ongoing IPL season. "When Virat Kohli hits his straps...final piece of the puzzle will be in place for RCB," he added. So far, Kohli has scored 119 runs in their seven games.

390.title: Ukraine given more aircraft, spare parts: Pentagon
390.article_body: The US' Pentagon has said that the Ukrainian military has received additional aircraft and spare parts to repair the damaged ones to help them in their fight against Russia. Pentagon spokesperson John Kirby, however, did not reveal which countries provided the aircraft. Ukraine has more operable fighter planes than it had two weeks ago, he added.

391.title: After US and UK, Canada imposes sanctions on Putin’s daughters
391.article_body: Days after the US and the UK imposed sanctions against Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, Canada announced similar measures in view of the ongoing Ukraine war. The country in a statement said that it was imposing targeted sanctions against 14 persons connected with Russia, which included Putin's two adult daughters - Katerina Vladimirovna Tikhonova and Maria Vladimirovna Vorontsova.

392.title: Tamil Nadu govt plans to develop airport in Hosur industrial belt
392.article_body: Tamil Nadu government is planning to develop an airport in the industrial belt of Hosur, located about 40 km from Bengaluru. State Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu on Tuesday, said Tamil Nadu Industrial Development Corporation Ltd (TIDCO) has been directed to study the air traffic, market demand and other aspects. TIDCO will reportedly select a consultant for undertaking the study.

393.title: Demolition drive in Delhi's Jahangirpuri stops after SC steps in for 2nd time
393.article_body: The anti-encroachment drive has been stopped in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, said Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, Delhi Police. This comes after the Supreme Court ordered that authorities must be directed to stop the demolition drive. Earlier today, the Supreme Court had stayed the demolition drive, however, the demolition continued for about an hour after that.

394.title: My friend's mom said 'Your making-out scene was very good': Isha Talwar
394.article_body: Sharing the reactions to her performance in Rishi Kapoor-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actress Isha Talwar said, "My friend's mom messaged me saying that my making out scene was very good and that I look really sexy." "This is the best feedback I have got so far," added Isha. "It has been very sweet and...very heartwarming," stated Isha.

395.title: Met Mira 10 times before marriage; I still wonder 'how did it happen': Shahid
395.article_body: When asked how getting married to Mira Rajput changed him, Shahid Kapoor said, "Mine was an arranged marriage. It wasn't a love marriage or friends who've known each other for a long time choosing to settle and [living] their lives together." "We met...10 times before we got married...When I look back even I wonder, 'How did it happen?'" he added.

396.title: Contempt petition filed against Raut for levelling allegations against HC judges
396.article_body: Indian Bar Association has filed a contempt petition-cum-PIL against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut and others for levelling "false, scandalous and contemptuous allegations" against judges of Bombay High Court in granting relief to BJP's Kirit Somaiya. The PIL also seeked action against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil and 'Saamana' Editor Rashmi Thackeray in the matter.

397.title: 'Heropanti 2' to feature the biggest action sequence ever filmed: Reports
397.article_body: Actors Tiger Shroff and Nawazuddin Siddiqui's upcoming film 'Heropanti 2' will reportedly feature the "biggest" action sequence to have ever been filmed. "It took a heart of an action director to tarnish 10 deluxe Lamborghinis," said a source as quoted by the report. "We had to hire the most competent stunt trainers who could make the...process smoother," added the source.

398.title: Comedy films are accorded 2nd class status: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya
398.article_body: Tamil actor Ravi Mariya said comedy films are "accorded" second class status, adding that reviews of such movies do not accord the importance they deserve. "Audiences enjoyed the comedy in [my film] 'Idiot' so much that the theatres reverberated with the sound of clapping...But some media persons said that the film was not funny at all," stated Ravi.

399.title: Apple products had 20% recycled materials in 2021, highest-ever
399.article_body: Apple has revealed that nearly 20% of all material used in Apple products in 2021 was recycled, the highest-ever use of recycled content. For the first time ever for any Apple product, Apple used recycled gold in the main logic board in the iPhone 13 and iPhone13 Pro. Apple products in 2021 included 45% certified recycled rare earth elements.

400.title: Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran will be part of moral science in K'taka: Min
400.article_body: Moral science will be part of the curriculum from this academic year and won't just be restricted to one religion, the Karnataka Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh said. The essence of all religions including Panchatantra, Ramayana, Mahabharata, Quran and others will be part of moral studies and there will be no exams on the subject, he said.

401.title: UPSC 2015 topper Tina Dabi to marry Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today
401.article_body: IAS officer Tina Dabi, who topped Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) examination in 2015 is set to marry senior IAS officer Dr Pradeep Gawande in Jaipur today. The marriage will reportedly take place at a five-star hotel in a private affair. According to reports, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has been invited to the wedding.

402.title: PBKS' Bairstow a big player but should get just 1 more game: Manjrekar
402.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said PBKS batter Jonny Bairstow is a "big" player with a good track record, but deserves just one more opportunity as batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa is in good form. Bairstow has scored 32 runs in three IPL 2022 matches so far for PBKS at a strike rate of 103.22. PBKS will take on DC today.

403.title: 22-yr-old run over by truck as bike skids on waterlogged road in B'luru
403.article_body: A 22-year-old man died as he was run over by a truck after his bike skidded on a waterlogged road in Bengaluru on Monday. His friend, who was the pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the accident. The mishap took place at Sampangiramnagar road near Corporation Circle when they were returning home from shopping after heavy rains.
